First ascent[7]: 8 August 1786  Jacques Balmat, Michel-Gabriel Paccard
Observations: Highest mountain of the Alps, border dispute France/Italy

First ascent[7]: 18 August 1822  F. Clissold, J. M. Couttet and five guides[13][14]
Easiest (normal) route to summit: Goûter Route (PD-/PD+) extension from summit of Mont Blanc
Observations: Fore-summit of Mont Blanc, border dispute France/Italy

First ascent[7]: 1 August 1855  Charles Hudson and 7 companions
Easiest (normal) route to summit: From Monte Rosa Hut via Monte Rosa glacier (III, 40°, AD-)
Observations: Highest peak of the Monte Rosa Massif, highest peak of the Alps outside of the Mont Blanc Massif

First ascent[7]: 26 August 1861  Edward N. Buxton, T.F. Buxton, John J. Cowell, Michel-Clément Payot, Binder
Easiest (normal) route to summit: From Monte Rosa Hut via Silbersattel (II, PD)

First ascent[7]: 1 August 1820  Joseph Zumstein, Joseph Vincent and Johann Niklaus Vincent and others
Easiest (normal) route to summit: From Gnifetti Hut (Italian side) via Lys glacier or Monte Rosa Hut (Swiss side) via Grenz glacier to Lys Col and then along the Western flank and SE ridge to the summit (I, PD)

First ascent[7]: 9 August 1842  Giovanni Gnifetti and 7 companions
Observations: Highest mountain hut and building in Europe, Capanna Regina Margherita, at 4,554 m.

First ascent[7]: 11 September 1858  John Llewelyn Davies, Johann Zumtaugwald, Johann Kronig, Hieronymous Brantschen
Easiest (normal) route to summit: From Domhütte via Northern flank to the summit (PD)
Observations: Highest peak located entirely within Switzerland

First ascent[7]: 19 August 1861  by 14 mountaineers
Easiest (normal) route to summit: From Gnifetti Hut via Lys glacier, Lys Col (Lisjoch) and East Ridge to the (Eastern) summit (II, AD)

First ascent[7]: 19 August 1861  John Tyndall, Johann Joseph Brennen, Ulrich Wenger
30 July 1862  John Llewelyn Davies, J.W. Hayward, Peter-Josef Summermatter, Stefan, Johann Zumtaugwald
Easiest (normal) route to summit: South East ridge from Mischabeljochbiwak (III, AD)

First ascent[7]: 19 August 1861  William E. Hall and 13 companions
Easiest (normal) route to summit: West flank from Quintino Sella Hut (PD+)

First ascent[7]: 14 July 1865  Croz, Taugwalder, Whymper, Hudson, Douglas and Hadow
Easiest (normal) route to summit: Hörnli ridge from Hörnli hut (III, AD)
